translated: That branch will make me pale and thin,
The one I love will grieve for me,
That branch will make me pale and thin,
By you, the one with dark-blue eyes,
That branch will make me pale and thin,
Surely it was told by him,
this was thought by me, the fool;
Having killed, and covered with branches,
The Birth Story of Parantapa is the eleventh.
The second sub-chapter on scents is finished.🔽The summary:
Varagāma, the great monkey, and Bhaggava,
Daḷhadhamma, the elephant, and the best of the Kesi deer;
The snake, the donkey, and the one who is awake,

analyzed: atha kosala adhipa parantapa ca ati
translated: Then the lord of Kosala, and Parantapa.
The summary of the sub-chapter:🔽Now listen as I recite the sub-chapter

original: vaggaṁ me bhaṇato suṇa;🔽Kukku ca puna gandhāro,
analyzed: vaggam me bhaṇataḥ suṇa  kukku ca puna gandhāraḥ
translated: In the Collection of Seven,🔽Two have been spoken by the Great Seer:
